title: Turret first blood and cancer meta
body: Season 6 has seen a drastic drop in the time it takes a team to start grouping, making the game much faster paced. It took some getting used to, but it became fun. However, the new turret first blood pushed the meta into a cancerous state. Games are now decided within the first 10 minutes without fail, and every game is a fucking clown fiesta four man gank squad circle jerk fest. I don't even know how to describe it, but the snowballing is out of control. I guess I get that Riot wanted to shift the LCS meta from lane swapping, but the meta for the other 98% of the player base is totally fucked and anti-fun.

replies.body:
> However, the new turret first blood pushed the meta into a cancerous state. Games are now decided within the first 10 minutes without fail

Oh please shut up. Games are NOT decided over 400 gold, ever. This is why you're low elo. If you give up your tower early you deserve to be put behind.

Funny you should mention that. I know someone who crawled the Riot API to find out the win rate based on that 400 tower first blood gold.

http://pty.li/tower/

Win rate after getting the first tower:

* Bronze 69.9%
* Silver 65.7% 
* Gold 69.1%
* Plat 66.4%
* Diamond 68.4%
* Masters 69.6%
* Challenger 72.7% 

Seems like it's got quite the impact to me.

My recent statistics show that the team, who took down the first nexus has a 100% winrate across every elo.
This is objective is actually too impactful.

I think technically the first Nexus triggers the end of the game, but it's the second Nexus to fall that wins. You can find videos where one team Surrenders as they kill the Nexus, the Nexus explodes in front of them, then it pans to their base as their Nexus explodes and they get a Defeat, despite killing the Nexus first. Not likely to happen without a surrender vote, but still.
This wasn't in my sample ;)
[https://media1.giphy.com/media/Y2nbrJyAR6RiM/200_s.gif](https://media1.giphy.com/media/Y2nbrJyAR6RiM/200_s.gif)

I can support this.

Recently I had an ARAM match where one of our players never connected. Two others went AFK and it was literally just me and one other guy valiantly defending our pitiful side of the bridge. Just after our Nexus exploded the camera panned to the other team's base and showed their Nexus exploding and the two of us somehow won.

I would say the last Nexus to fall loses, but if your Nexus explodes you are really, really unlikely to make a comeback unless the other team throws hard.

Bless those good people.
A+ response
